list-item.p: There is an abundance of data showing that RV-C and RV-A contribute to asthma development and/or is a marker of asthma susceptibility.
Using viral markers in relation to treatment might be a good strategy to prevent asthma.
Oral application of corticosteroids may change the natural history of asthma.
Treatment of virus-induced wheezing/asthma exacerbations with high-dose corticosteroids prevents destructive cytokine release in the airways.
